other_comments:
Sustainable wood veneers have many environmental benefits:
Low embodied energy
Carbon storage – growing trees absorb carbon dioxide which is then “locked up” for the life of the tree and wooden products made from that tree
Land use and biodiversity – Sustainably managed native forests are a natural ecosystem and consequently have high biodiversity. Plantations also support a reasonable degree of biodiversity.
Wood is a renewable resource
Veneer is one of the most environmentally efficient and economical ways to use beautiful timbers because one cubic metre of veneer can cover more than 1,000 m2 of panel surface

The Briggs Group is committed to the responsible use of the world’s resources. We are proud to have pioneered the use of Australian sustainable hardwoods for veneer, harvested in accordance with passing the strict environmental guidelines that are required by Government. By law, Australian State Forest land cannot be permanently cleared; it must always be replanted or regenerated.  Sustainable harvest means that the amount of timber that grows back each year is greater than, or equal to, the amount harvested. Furthermore, such forests are managed in accordance with strict laws and regulations to protect biodiversity, endangered species, water quality and other environmental values.  Additionally, all the Australian veneer that we get sliced, and all the veneer that we import, is checked under our Due Diligence program as being legally harvested.

product_description: An acoustic drop-in ceiling tile with superior sound absorption and PEFC-cert. solid timber elegance
standard_dimensions: 600 Tile: 595mm (w) x 595mm (h) / 1200 Tile: 1195mm (w) x 595mm (h) - To fit 600 x 600mm or 1200 x 600mm T-Frame grid
recyclable_percentage_description: Ecoustic Blade ceiling tiles can be returned to Instyle for recirculating, recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
recyclable_offcuts_description: Generally there will be no wastage or offcuts with Ecoustic Blade ceiling tiles as they are designed to fit into new and existing ceiling grids, however all Ecoustic product materials can be returned to Instyle for recirculating, recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
reusable_description: Ecoustic Blade is designed for modularity and is pre-fabricated allowing for easy + efficient installation without adhesives or permanent fixtures; tiles can simply be dropped into new and existing T-Frame ceiling systems. This allows for easy separation of materials at end of product lifecycle.
end_of_life_program_description: Ecoustic Blade ceiling tiles can be returned to Instyle for recirculating, recycling or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/Ecoustic Blade ceiling tiles can be returned to Instyle for recirculating or reprocessing through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme: https://instyle.com.au/revive-recycling-program/
water_reduction_techniques: Water is not used in the manufacturing of this product.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Sydney-based manufacturing, consolidated shipments, efficient packing and optimised routes are all employed to reduce emissions.
minimisation_design_strategy: Wastage is minimal as Ecoustic Blade tiles are pre-fabricated with dimensions designed to fit perfectly into T-Frame suspended ceiling systems with a nominal 1200 x 600mm grid. The Ecoustic design team can provide efficient installation guidance for our Ecoustic products depending on project requirements.
risk_of_harm_posed_description: The scrim used as a backing in Ecoustic Blade products can release microplastics during use and at end of life, posing health & environmental risks. This can be mitigated by returning the product to Instyle for responsible separation and recycling through our REVIVE® product stewardship scheme.
specific_installation_methods: Ecoustic Blade is designed for modularity and is pre-fabricated allowing for easy + efficient installation without adhesives or permanent fixtures; tiles can simply be dropped into new and existing T-Frame ceiling systems. This allows for easy separation of materials at end of product lifecycle. Follow the accompanying installation + care guides for installation guidelines that maximise product longevity.
other_comments: Additional certifications or product literature may be available on request – please contact your Instyle Sales Representative for more details.
type_of_packaging: Our circular packaging strategy for Ecoustic products uses 84% recycled cardboard, reusable pallets, and recycled paper. We continuously reduce polymer use, currently limited only to tapes and necessary bagging where no viable sustainable alternative exists.

end_of_life_program_description:
Products reach the end of their product life cycle for several reasons. Decor Systems recognises that end-of-life milestones are often key to maintaining environmental sustainability initiatives.

With that in mind, we have set out below our End of Product Lifecycle Policy which aims to dually maintain the ongoing sustainability of our products and simultaneously support school facilities in areas that are designated in lower socio-economic regions.

If our acoustic panel systems attain their end of life due to building demolition or refurbishment, Decor Systems commits to donating usable panels to educational facilities (schools, training centres, childcare, etc.) in regions identified as having a high proportion of students with learning challenges.

Special consideration is given to centres that focus on literacy programs for Indigenous students.

The following conditions apply:

Liaise with Decor Systems to determine suitability before panels are returned. Photos will be required both before and after dismantling to ascertain suitability.
Panels to be dismantled and returned to Decor Systems at the client’s cost.
Panels must be in reasonable condition in their original manufactured sizes.
The final decision will rest with Decor Systems as to the suitability of the panels for re-deployment to alternative projects.
minimisation_design_strategy: Decor Systems offers free shop drawings to ensure accurate site measurement and minimal wastage. We also offer a site measurement service using the latest technology for added accuracy.
modern_slavery_comments:
Decor Systems is committed to ethical business practices and the eradication of modern slavery in all its forms. We firmly believe in upholding human rights, promoting social responsibility, and maintaining transparency in our operations and supply chains. This Modern Slavery Statement outlines our approach to combating modern slavery and human trafficking, the steps we have taken to prevent its occurrence, and our plans for continuous improvement.

INTRODUCTION
This is the second Modern Slavery Statement submitted by Decor Systems. Decor Systems has elected to publish this statement voluntarily, as informed by the Modern Slavery Act 2018.

The purpose of this statement is to outline the business’ systems for identifying the risk of modern slavery in our operations and supply chain and implementing processes to minimise any risk.

Decor Systems recognise that slavery and human trafficking can occur in many forms including forced labour, child labour, human trafficking, forced marriage and deceptive methods of recruiting labour.

Decor Systems are committed to operating responsibly and maintaining ethical standards across our operations, with a particular focus on risk areas within our supply chain.

STRUCTURE
Decor Systems is a family owned Australian owned and operated vertically integrated manufacturer, supplier and retailer of architectural acoustic panel systems.

Our headquarters, manufacturing and supply facility located in Glendenning, NSW. Decor Systems maintains offices in Brisbane and Melbourne.

OPERATIONS AND SUPPLY CHAINS
Decor Systems is committed to the superior design, production and supply of quality products and services. We have been in the business for over 50 years and offer an extensive range of innovative products, professional services, experience, and industry knowledge.

With a growing team of Sales and Project Consultants located throughout Australia, , a modern manufacturing and supply facility and an international sourcing team, Decor Systems has a valued reputation for reliably delivering state-of-the-art architectural solutions.

Decor Systems’ supply chain includes both local and overseas suppliers with whom the business has established, long-standing supply agreements in place.

Our manufacturing facility produces custom and made-to-order products, sourcing raw materials and componentry from tier one suppliers mostly located in Australia.

Our importing division sources and assembles materials that requires little or no customisation, with raw materials sourced largely from suppliers located in Germany, USA and Latvia, as well as some local Australian suppliers.

ADDRESSING THE RISK OF MODERN SLAVERY PRACTICES
The Decor Systems executive team are committed to ethical procurement and oppose slavery in all its forms.

Policies and risk management processes have been implemented to identify and address the risk of modern slavery in our supply chain. This includes routine supplier evaluation and supply chain mapping that encompasses a range of environmental and ethical risks, including modern slavery.

Within this supply chain analysis, BFX has identified two areas of risk. First, a generally low risk of modern slavery in the construction supplies sector. Second, some second-tier suppliers where materials are imported from overseas have a medium geographic and entity risk.

DUE DILIGENCE AND REMEDIATION PROCESSES
To date, Decor Systems has had no reported incidents of modern slavery or breaches by its overseas suppliers.

Nevertheless, Decor Systems recognises the inherent risk of slavery and human trafficking within the supply chain and has established internal processes to guide supplier selection and tendering, including:

Consideration of certain factors before a supplier is awarded a supply contract. For example, the potential supplier’s reputation, ability to supply, integrity, financial strength and compliance with legislation and best practice.
Ensuring that Decor Systems do not purchase materials from suppliers that breach the UN Guiding Principles. If any existing suppliers are found to have breached the UN Guiding Principles, Decor Systems will take immediate steps to reassess those supply arrangements.
Staff training within Decor Systems direct supply chain,in which supplier evaluation is conducted prior to engagement of suppliers.
Existing suppliers are audited in line with Decor Systems GECA, FSC and Illegal Logging Audit requirements.
FUTURE COMMITMENTS
Over the next year, Decor Systems focus areas will be:

Further refining our procurement processes and training our procurement team with best practice initiatives.
Reviewing identified risk areas in the supply chain and reporting to the Decor Systems board.
David Faulkes
Chief Executive Officer
other_comments: Decor Systems is Indigenous-owned with Supply Nation certification. https://decorsystems.com.au/products/decorzen/

minimisation_design_strategy: Specifying the correct board sizes to ensure minimal wastage and max use of the board product

product_description: Curated range of sustainable recomposed timber veneers

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems
Joinery and benchtop materials and systems

recyclable_offcuts_description: Yes — we encourage designers to reuse or upcycle offcuts and can provide guidance on effective ways to minimise waste.
reusable_description: The product can be reused where appropriate; its demountability depends on the installation method and application conditions.
water_reduction_techniques: Yes, 70% recycled water used at Veneer manufacturing site
minimisation_design_strategy: Align panel and joinery dimensions with standard sheet sizes to maximise material yield. For instance, designing 600 mm wide modules from a 1200 mm wide sheet minimises offcuts and waste compared to non-modular dimensions.
specific_installation_methods: Yes — where mechanical fixings are used, panels can be designed for demountability and reuse. Adhesive methods may limit recyclability or reinstallation potential.
applied_finish_required_description: Once fabricated, the timber veneer will need to be sealed. There are various options depending on the level of protection required, ranging from oils and waxes through to 2 pack polyurethane.
type_of_packaging: Reusable timber crates and pallets are used with recyclable plastic strapping. Veneer and edging are packaged in recycled cardboard. Veneer crates are wrapped in plastic to protect the veneer from water & sun light - this can be reused.

product_description: Particle Decorative Board is a moisture-resistant E0 & E1 Particleboard bonded with resin.

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems
Joinery and benchtop materials and systems

lead_time: Generally in stock - MTO will attract lead time

certifications.certification: Programme for the Endorsement of Forest Certification

recyclable_percentage_description: Onshore recycling facility installed at local Manufacturing plants.
recyclable_offcuts_description: The manufacturing of particleboard utilises recycled wood and off cuts in the production of new particleboard at Oberon facility. Offcuts of MDF is used for packing material and gluts.
recycling_process_description:
reDirect Wood Recycling has been established to provide a closed loop particleboard and wood recycling service. By installing a reDirect Recycling service you will enjoy significant cost savings in landfill charges.
The reDirect Wood Recovery Initiative has been designed to service polytec customers who are buying raw and melamine coated particleboard products. reDirect Wood Recycling will reclaim materials that would otherwise go to landfill, thereby reducing waste, preserving plantation pine forests and protecting the environment for future generations. The manufacturing of particleboard utilises recycled wood and off cuts in the production of new particleboard. By opting for wood off cut collection through reDirect Recycling you are assisting in creating sustainable manufacturing practices.
reusable_description: The entire product with edging or laminate can be recycled or repurposed.
end_of_life_program_description:
reDirect Wood Recycling has been established to provide a closed loop particleboard and wood recycling service. By installing a reDirect Recycling service you will enjoy significant cost savings in landfill charges.
The reDirect Wood Recovery Initiative has been designed to service polytec customers who are buying raw and melamine coated particleboard products. reDirect Wood Recycling will reclaim materials that would otherwise go to landfill, thereby reducing waste, preserving plantation pine forests and protecting the environment for future generations. The manufacturing of particleboard utilises recycled wood and off cuts in the production of new particleboard. By opting for wood off cut collection through reDirect Recycling you are assisting in creating sustainable manufacturing practices.
water_reduction_techniques:
polytec’s main source of water comes from our Waste Water Treatment Plant (WWTP). Community
town water is used only to supplement that which is consumed as recycled and softened water.
The WWTP treats effluent to a tertiary treatment level through Ultra filtration (UF) and Reverse
Osmosis (RO) and returned to the MDF facility as softened water for use in the boilers and or
manufacturing process. Approximately 2/3 of our Oberon Manufacturing facility daily water
requirement is supplied by our WWTP.
With the exception of a portion of the HPP site, the WWTP manages all the wastewater and
stormwater from the surrounding sites at the Oberon Timber Complex (OTC).
minimisation_design_strategy: Designing to the sheet sizes and try to optimise the sheet to its maximum.

detailed_certifications.certification: Programme for the Endorsement of Forest Certification

other_comments: Our website https://www.polytec.com.au/ contains all product information, including technical specifications, installation information and warranty. The EPD data is from the substrate.
type_of_packaging: Gluts and strapping.

end_of_life_program_description: MDF is acceptable for energy recovery.
water_reduction_techniques:
polytec’s main source of water comes from our Waste Water Treatment Plant (WWTP). Community
town water is used only to supplement that which is consumed as recycled and softened water.
The WWTP treats effluent to a tertiary treatment level through Ultra filtration (UF) and Reverse
Osmosis (RO) and returned to the MDF facility as softened water for use in the boilers and or
manufacturing process. Approximately 2/3 of our Oberon Manufacturing facility daily water
requirement is supplied by our WWTP.
With the exception of a portion of the HPP site, the WWTP manages all the wastewater and
stormwater from the surrounding sites at the Oberon Timber Complex (OTC).
minimisation_design_strategy: Waste deduction is most effective when production is optimised for the highest possible yield of decorative board.

Various finishes including Matt, Texture, Woodmatt, Sheen,

product_description: Easycraft Contours offer a versatile design solution for walls, ceiling and joinery.

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems
Joinery and benchtop materials and systems

certifications.certification: Programme for the Endorsement of Forest Certification

recyclable_percentage_description: The entire product can be demounted for energy recovery.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Remember during onsite installation the product has been designed for no offcuts, as all optimisations completed at manufacture in Australia step with the size of the panels. During manufacturing, offcuts is used for packing material and gluts, and can be used in energy recovery.
reusable_description: The entire product can be demounted for reuse or energy recovery.
water_reduction_techniques:
polytec’s main source of water comes from our Waste Water Treatment Plant (WWTP). Community
town water is used only to supplement that which is consumed as recycled and softened water.
The WWTP treats effluent to a tertiary treatment level through Ultra filtration (UF) and Reverse
Osmosis (RO) and returned to the MDF facility as softened water for use in the boilers and or
manufacturing process. Approximately 2/3 of our Oberon Manufacturing facility daily water
requirement is supplied by our WWTP.
With the exception of a portion of the HPP site, the WWTP manages all the wastewater and
stormwater from the surrounding sites at the Oberon Timber Complex (OTC).
minimisation_design_strategy: The whole design of Easycraft Contours enables almost no onsite waste as products are sizes designed for install areas ready to put in with minimal additional resources and quicker time.

detailed_certifications.certification: Programme for the Endorsement of Forest Certification

specific_installation_methods: Easycraft Contours is designed from the outset to require less time and resources for fixing. This easy install has avoided additional time and materials for fixing. This improves reuse opportunities.
other_comments: Our website https://www.polytec.com.au contains all product information, including technical specifications, EPDs, installation information and warranty.
type_of_packaging: Gluts and strapping.
